intro: Centropogon gutierrezii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows in high-altitude environments, often in cloud forests, where it thrives in cool and humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
